definition: to hold a funeral procession and burial/to give sb a final send-off/(fig.) to ruin (one's future prospects etc)
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: Is it I that ruin the kingdom of Lordaeron?
sentences.chinese: 難道是朕將洛丹倫葬送的嗎？

sentences.english: They have dropped 10 points from leading positions.
sentences.chinese: 他們在領先情況下葬送了10分。

sentences.english: However, this sentiment is buried in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 然而這種情調卻葬送在我心。

sentences.english: Using long blade clasped my acs lag.
sentences.chinese: 用長刃的殤葬送我的英華。

sentences.english: For every minute we wait, many more lives go in vain in Gaza.
sentences.chinese: 我們每等多一分鐘，有更多生命就會白白地葬送。

sentences.english: But one accident almost ruins his career. It happened in his stunts.
sentences.chinese: 只是在拍戲過程中，一個小事故差點葬送了他的事業。

definition: to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
to suffer the painful loss of (a loved one etc)/to miss out on (an opportunity)/to fail to gain (victory etc)
to lose one's life/to get killed
